fields.summary: Allow bulk association of project schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31314].
  {panel}

The out-of-the-box "Assigned to Me" filter currently does not include resolved issues in the filter results.

A number of other users have inquired about this and the suggested work-around is to build a custom filter and use the Filter Results gadget.

Many new users to JIRA expect that the "Assigned to Me" does indeed reflect what's in their "inbox" - they do not know intuitively that it excludes resolved issues.

A nice enhancement would be to include an option to include unresolved issues (perhaps in the form of a checkbox on the gadgets configuration screen).
fields.summary: Assigned to Me Gadget should have option for including unresolved issues

fields.description:
Custom field not showing in Issue Navigator even when filters limited to those the custom field is set for

I've read through https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Custom+Field+Not+Appearing+in+Issue+Navigator+Search+Criteria and whilst that's useful even if I filter down to just the project and issue type that the custom field is set to the field is still now showing in the issue navigator.

Steps taken;
1) Set up a custom field called "Due Date" linked to project A, and issue types x, y and z.
2) Created issues with the Due Date field populated
3) Gone to Issue Navigator to create a filter
4) Added the Due Date field to Issue Navigator using the Tools >>> Configure Columns option
5) Filtered for Project A, issue types x, y, and z
6) Due Date column not displayed as requested.

Strangely, if I apply an extra filter using the Custom Field Due Date e.g. choose a Due Date (after) value, the column then displays and is populated for all records?
fields.summary: Custom field not showing in Issue Navigator even when filters limited to those the custom field is set for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31310].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
1. Go to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/Signup!default.jspa
2. Fill all fields with proper data. Fill captcha field with value that doesn't match the image.
3. Push sign up button

The page will reload and no error message will be displayed.

I've tested that on Google Chrome. Tested with 3 JIRA versions (current ondemand, 5.2.4 (JAC), 5.1.6).

The attachment shows page after submitting the form.

All other fields correctly shows errors when invalid value is provided.
fields.summary: Sign-up form doesn't shows error message when incorrect captcha is provided - the page just reloads without proper message
Ability to exclude the Release Version in Fixed Version/Affected Version
Show the creator of an issue in the History tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31302].
  {panel}

For Project Versions, the *Description* field does not appear to contain a character limit. As a result, descriptions can extend beyond the CSS borders, creating scroll bars. 
 
Also, the description field is 1 continuous field without formatting options. We have a customer inquiring about how to add a line to the description:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/102740/project-versions-how-can-i-add-a-new-line-in-the-description-of-a-version?page=1#124356 

IMO, if the description field was limited in character size, it might also make adding descriptions more intuitive. It does not seem intuitive to allow  a lot of text into the field unless we compliment it with formatting options (line breaks, bolding, italics, etc). 

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian
fields.summary: Project Versions > description fields extends CSS border

h4. Actual results:
You pick a date after 12/31/2031 it will yield a date from early 1900's.

For example, picking 12/31/2032 yields 12/31/1932 when the field is saved.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

h4. Expected behavior: 

JIRA should set the correct date.

h4. Workaround:

No workaround available.
fields.summary: JIRA Date Picker not working for dates after 2031
Newly installed JIRA fails to start

fields.description:
I have a workflow, and a workflow scheme for a project. In this workflow, I have a step name 'Waiting'. I have a Transition 'On Hold' that leads from the 'Open' and 'In Progress' states to 'Waiting'. The assignee of an issue can perform that transition with no validation. This workflow is active, and the project in question is using it as part of it's workflow scheme.

If my reading of the documentation is correct, an issue assigned to me in the 'Open' state should be allowed to move to 'Waiting' via the 'On Hold' transition. However, that transition / state is not available to me for issues in that state (or on 'In Progress').

I've attached screenshots of the workflow, transitions, etc. If you need more info, please let me know.
fields.summary: Transition not available
Installer should throw error message when service install failed

h4. Summary
When inline edit is *ON*, clicking the description box will enable quick edit. Meanwhile, clicking anywhere outside quick edit will automatically saves the edit. However, user might accidentally made changes to the description.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31283].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
The documentation on [Using Quick Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Quick+Search] should be edited to prevent misleading guide. This is because Quick Search does not support searching multiple words.  For example, searching for resolution like "Cannot Reproduce" will not shows all results with the same resolution. Other issues with not "Cannot Reproduce" will also be shown. However, in documentation, the resolution, for instance, consists of two words: {{cannot reproduce}}.

h4. Improvement Request
This has been raised here: [JRA-5114|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5114]
fields.summary: Documentation on Quick Search should be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31279].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Browser Information is not being collected at all the Issue Collector when the environment field is not on the default screen in the given project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an empty JIRA instance
# Create a new project on that instance
# Create an issue collector inside the project making sure that the "Collect browser information" checkbox is checked
# Embed the issue collector on some website (e.g. http://jsbin.com/)
# Create issue using embeded collector
# Navigate to the issue

h3. Expected Results
The new issue should have the browser information stored in the environment field.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue doesn't have the environment field and it doesn't have the browser information.
 
h3. Notes
The reason it happens seems to be that the environment field is no longer on default screens for projects and therefore is discarded during issue creation.

h3.Workaround
To work around this issue add the environment system field to the *default* create screen in the project you set up the issue collector. New issues created in this project using issue collector will have the browser information collected in the environment field.
fields.summary: Browser Information not collected in Issue Collector in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31273].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

# Export a known good workflow as XML
# Find the linked status IDs for any step and replace them with IDs that do not refer to statuses
# Re-import the workflow and use it in a project

This means that workflows could be made active which contain steps without a valid status. I have not attempted to transition an issue to such a step, but I suspect it would either make the transition fail, or corrupt the issue because the status does not exist.

As a platform it would be nice if JIRA could maintain the integrity of this data so that GreenHopper doesn't have to second-guess it.
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow XML import does not validate statuses which are linked to steps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31266].
  {panel}

The start-jira.sh script could correctly set the JAVA_HOME variable for users by:

# using uname to detect 'darwin'

# if uname is 'darwin', set JAVA_HOME to `/usr/libexec/java_home`
e.g. export JAVA_HOME=`/usr/libexec/java_home`

See this post by Apple Inc.

http://lists.apple.com/archives/java-dev/2011/Jul/msg00172.html

Putting all these pieces together, the script is:


{code}
case "`uname`" in
  Darwin*) if [ -z "$JAVA_HOME" ] ; then
             JAVA_HOME=`/usr/libexec/java_home`
           fi
           ;;
esac
{code}
to remove the need to force OS X users to setup a JAVA_HOME variable.
fields.summary: Reduce installation friction by setting JAVA_HOME correctly under OS X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31265].
  {panel}

This functionality seems to work sometimes work but 

a) Does not always echo back the same way it does in confluence. As I recall, sometimes you can type in the @ and your team list will appear and echo what you type, sometimes nothing appears, but when you type @teammember  and save the issue the link shows up.
b) In some contexts nothing happens at all, either when you type the @ or when you try to type @teammember and save. No dice.

To be honest, I'm not exactly sure how often it's working, just know it doesn't always work, leading me to pull hair. (Well, kinda)

It would be most helpful if this functionality worked from *every* issue comment view, including:
- Workflows, 
- Edit issue, 
- Full issue page, 
- Green Hopper commenting

There are many ways you can comment, and IMHO they should all behave the same way, or your users will be required to avoid certain forms in favor of the ones that work right.

I get so used to typing @ in Confluence that it bums me out when nothing happens in Jira. And then when it appears to work sometimes and not others, it's a bit crazy making.
fields.summary: Inconsistent function of @ mention of team member in comments and description, similar to Confluence shortcut.

  {panel}

It would be most helpful if this functionality worked from *every* issue comment view, including:
- Workflows, 
- Edit issue, 
- Full issue page, 
- Green Hopper commenting

This is really an issue of supporting integration of both systems. I get so used to typing [ in Confluence that it bums me out when nothing happens in Jira and I have to manually find the link button and click it.
fields.summary: Trigger links to Confluence pages from linked Confluence space using [ key in comments and description, similar to Confluence shortcut.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31260].
  {panel}

When bulk moving issues from one project to another, the original sequence of the issues issue key will be lost during the process. 

As an example, I've created 2 projects (Source Project and Target Project), and created 10 test issues under Source Project:
!sourceproject.png!

After bulk moving all 10 issues to the Target Project, the original sequence of the issue key is lost, seems like the new issue key are randomly assigned to those issues:
!targetproject.png!

Hence, it will be great if the original issue key sequence is retained when bulk moving issues, or at least give the user an option to choose the original sequence or not.
fields.summary: Bulk move issues will ignore the issue key sequence in the source project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31250].
  {panel}

Users who are familiar with mainstream SQL expect to be able to specify date fields down to the second.

We would like to be able to format JQL queries as follows:

createdDate >= "2013-01-11 00:00:00" and createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59:59"

We know that date data is stored in the database down to the second, as using createdDate <= "2013-01-11 23:59" excludes any issues created during the last minute of the day.
fields.summary: Allow JQL querying down to the second on all date fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31245].
  {panel}

Consider that there are two project A and B, who have a common component called "shared".

With the filter "component = shared":
# In the issue navigator, it will search all issue in all project with the component.
# In the twodimensionfilter output, it consider the output as two components in different projects like 
|| ||Components|| ||
||projct||shared||shared||
|A|1|0|
|B|0|1|
As the output become two queries "component = shared AND project = A" and "component = shared AND project = B". 

It should be great that it can be consolidate those two components column to only one: 
|| ||Components||
||projct||shared||
|A|1|
|B|1|
which will directly reflect to the filter using in the gadget.
fields.summary: Allow twodimensionfilter consolidate the same column with the cross projects search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31243].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an Issue Collector is added to an iFrame it is not possible to close the 'create issue' dialog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow the steps to reproduce JRA-45229.
# Follow the workaround on [JRA-45229|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45229] to be able to open the collector.
# Try to close the dialog or submit the form and wait for the dialog to be automatically closed.

h3. Expected Results
The dialog would be closed.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on the 'Close' link or submitting the form does not close the dialog.
 
h3. Notes
* This started happening before JRA-45229, but now the workaround on it should be applied to be able to reproduce this problem.

{panel:title=Original Description}
Error is:
You're are trying to create a ToggleBlock with selector '.toggle-trigger'.One already exists with this trigger so has been ignored.

When clicked on the "report problem" button, the following shows up in firebug:

Your are trying to create a ToggleBlock with selector '.toggle-trigger'.One already exists with this trigger so has been ignored.

OS: Linux
Browser: Mozilla Firefox 17.0.1
{panel}
fields.summary: Issue Collector cannot be closed when within an iFrame

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31237].
  {panel}

With a Select List custom field, it is not presently possible to add a Description for each option.  Once implemented this benefits the user in various ways:

(1) Shown inside the combo dropdown:
      [Critical - Crashes, exceptions, can't access feature]
      [Major - loss of function with no workaround         ]
    Where the option is in bold and the description in light text is shown after it.

(2) Hover text for the currently selected option can be displayed when hovering over the Field.

(3) Automatically generating a yellow Help icon that could be placed to the right of a custom field - same as Priority, etc - that shows all these Options and their Descriptions.

Currently the only way to educate users on the meaning of custom field options is to describe them all in the Description - this produces a very long block of text that takes up space on the page and annoys the more experienced users.
fields.summary: Add an optional description for each Select List option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31227].
  {panel}

I'm considering moving from Podio to JIRA. I'd like to note that Podio is horrible at a lot of things that JIRA is excellent at, however there are two things that makes Podio very useful that JIRA does not have. One of those things is the Notification Center

Basically, I don't want to check my email for new updates to JIRA. I want all those updates to be piled up in a notification center, kind of like how Facebook does it. I don't want to have to refresh the screen. I don't even want to have to switch to the tab to find out if there are any new notifications for me.

1) When a ticket is assigned to me, or when I am @mentioned in a comment, or when a ticket that is assigned to me gets updated or commented on, I want a notification.
2) I want the notification to appear automatically in a little box along the top bar of the page (an icon with a number over it). I don't want to have to refresh the page in order to see if I have new notifications.
3) I want the number of unacknowledged notifications I have to appear in the title of the page, so that I can be browsing in other tabs and still be aware of when a new notification comes in.
4) I want everything to be very simple; I don't want to have to click multiple times to acknowledge a notification to make it go away. Simply clicking once on the notification and viewing it should be enough.
5) I want a backlog of my notification history.
6) When I click on the notification, I want to be taken to the item that triggered it.
fields.summary: Notification Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31210].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

We need to review the following documentation:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+Bugzilla

When importing data from BugZilla, JIRA needs to connect on its database using an external driver. However, JIRA is unable to connect in previous MySQL databases such as MySQL 4.0 (which is used by BugZilla 2.20 -- a really old version).

So where it said:

{quote}
Version 4.1 or later of the JIRA Importers plugin is compatible with Bugzilla 2.20 to 4.0.2. Users of older Bugzilla versions will need to first upgrade the Bugzilla database tables to a supported version, using Bugzilla's checksetup.pl script. The JIRA Importers plugin requires that your Bugzilla database is MySQL, PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL Server.
{quote}

We shall specify that JIRA is able to import data from BugZilla 2.20 *only* if it's using a [supported database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] -- In this case, MySQL 5.1 or higher.

Best regards,
Lucas Timm
fields.summary: Review documentation "Importing Data from Bugzilla"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31202].
  {panel}

Here is the way that I would like to log in to jira.  This is the way the application that I work on is set up, and it makes much more sense.

enter user name
tab
enter password 
tab
hit space to check the checkbox to leave me logged in
return

the current tabbing order in jira forces me to do this:
enter user name
tab
enter password
tab
tab
check box
return

I'm baffled why you would ever have log in before the checkbox in the tabbing order.
fields.summary: change the order of login and "leave me logged in checkbox" in tabbing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31199].
  {panel}

When a user updated a description for an issue, the notification email does not rendered the wiki markup.  For example, the description field is updated:
!description.png!

Then, on the notification email, the content does not rendered the wiki markup:
!edit-desc.png!

h4. Note: 
* The field description is already configured to Wiki Style Renderer
* Tested on JIRA 5.1.2, 5.1.3, 5.2.4, 6.1.2, 6.1.5
* When creating the issue, the first notification formats correctly
* Subsequent updates will not render the wiki markup
* Any new comments on the issue will show the description un-rendered in the notifications, but will show the comment rendered correctly if there is any wiki formatting in the comment.
* Any edits on existing comments will not render the wiki markup
fields.summary: Notification on updated Description or Environment field does not render the wiki markup

Hi Team,
   I still cannot access old JIRA's in the new JIRA system. Allen Lin says he cannot duplicate the error so I have no other choice but to create new JIRA's every single time until the issue is resolved. There is already a Mammoth Hobbies JIRA in place, please note that.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31193].
  {panel}

Auto-highlighting of entire field upon selection for inline editing makes it easy to delete entire description.

We've just launched Jira defect management in the past couple weeks, and have multiple people notice the following issue: 
1. clicking on a field opens it up for inline editing. 
2. opening a free text field for inline editing highlights the entire text body. 
3. clicking off field saves changes to the selected field. 
This combination of factors causes this to happen: 

1. a laptop user is typing something anywhere (e.g. a word document, or the quick search field). 
2. as can easily happen with a laptop touchpad, they brush against the touchpad, which it interprets as a left-click. 
3. because the mouse arrow was currently hovering over the description field, the description is opened for editing and the entire description is highlighted. 
4. not noticing that focus has changed, the user continues typing, causing the entire description to be deleted. 
5. The user notices that what they have been typing is not appearing in the quick search field, and they click on the quick search field. 
6. the deletion of the description is saved. 

In most cases, people have noticed when they've accidentally deleted large blocks of text. But sometimes they haven't and it has only been caught because a watcher received an edit notification and they questioned why this would happen.
fields.summary: Don't auto-highlight entire field upon inline edit
Mail Handler to comment only with associated projects
COMMUTIL ERROR when commisioning custom iso build

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31184].
  {panel}

At present the backup produced by the backup manager cannot be imported back into OnDemand as the attachments and XML are in the same zip file. Could the Backup Manager produce 3 zip files:

* XML
* Avatars (taken directly from the avatars directory)
* Attachments (taken directly from the attachments directory)

This is useful for customers as if they need to make a risky change to JIRA and take a backup before and after then it's not possible for them to restore the data without downloading the archive and manually altering it.

WORKAROUND:
[Restoring a JIRA Cloud Backup into a JIRA Cloud instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Restoring+a+JIRA+Cloud+Backup+into+a+JIRA+Cloud+instance]

# Download the backup
# Extract all files out of the zip file
# Zip up entities.xml and activeobjects.xml - this will be your XML data.
# Change directory into data/attachments and zip up the contents - this will be your attachment data.
# Change directory into data/avatars and zip up the contents - this will be your avatar data.
# [Import the file back into OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Issues]
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand Backup Manager should produce a backup that can be imported back into OnDemand

Can we work out some way to stay on top of these updates so that Support doesn't have to keep prodding for plugins like these to be updated?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31175].
  {panel}

Even with the correct name on others project reports and on Project Title, the ampersand character is not being correctly treated. To reproduce the error, just follow these steps:

1- Pick a project (any project)
2- From the project Summary page, locate the Reports section, and select the Project Pivot Report
3- From the Configure – Project Pivot Report page, open the drop down box for ‘ Project (Optional)’
4- If a project name includes the ampersand (‘&’) character, the list project name will appear to show the HTML entity.
As an example, if the name of a project is ‘Test & Trouble’ the drop down will show ‘Test & Trouble’

Please see the error on the attached screenshot:


!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/82603/special_chars.png!

Looks like "" presents the same error.
fields.summary: Ampersand are not being correctly treated on Project dropdown menu of Project Pivot Report configurator.

  {panel}

We execute a test case that the Disk Space is less than threshold value and a Low Disk Space ALARM is raised.

We come up with the following info logs from kernel:
"attempt to access beyond end of device"
"loop0: rw=1, want=366, limit=256"
"quiet_error: 12 callbacks suppressed"
Then we see the error:
"Buffer I/O error on device loop0".

We believe that is a platform related issue. Could you please investigate the case or provide us with more info about these info logs and error?

JIRA Issue macros on CAC that were configured a long time ago are no longer returning results.

Examples:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.7.4+Release+Notes]
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Crowd+1.2+Release+Notes]
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+2.6.1+Release+Notes]

Note that slightly newer configured macros are still working correctly e.g. [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.8.1+Release+Notes]

The issue could be with Confluence, however, looking at the macro parameters suggests that an older query format has either been broken or dropped in JIRA. Assigning to JIRA to investigate.
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA issues macro no longer returning results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31159].
  {panel}

When moving issue from one project to another project:-

Even though the user does not have the right permission in the destination project, the issue is being move without any warning. 

h5. +Use case+
# User "Test" does *NOT* have assignable permission in Project B
!3.PNG!
# User "Test" having assignable permission in Project A
!2.PNG!
# When moving issue from Project A to Project B, user "Test" still select-able and appear in the selection drop-down list.
!4.png!
# The issue is being moved and the user "Test" is the assignee which he doesn't have the permission
!5.PNG!

h5. +Expected Result+
# The issue moving should unsuccessful since user "Test" doesn't have assignable permission

\\
{panel:| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
h5. (i) This also applied to Create Issue Permission.
# When user do not have the Create Issue Permission, the user still select-able and appear in the selection drop-down list. 
# There is no warning or error shown and the moving progress is successful.
{panel}
fields.summary: Permission is not being Obeyed when moving issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31158].
  {panel}

The create issue screen will remember the previous issue creation's field configuration.  For example:
# Make the component field not required and create an issue without the component field on the screen.  The create issue screen will remember the previous field configuration
!step1.png!
# Make the component field required
!step2.png!
# Try to create an issue and the component field will not be displayed on the create issue screen
!step3.png!

However, when a user tries to create an issue, the component field will automatically appear on the screen, and JIRA will prompt an exception requesting for a value for the required field. 

It would be convenient for users to know what fields are required when creating an issue, regardless of the previous field configuration.
fields.summary: Required field should automatically appear on the create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31154].
  {panel}

After change the _View Version Control_ permission to _View Issue Source Tab_, we still have a documentation showing the old name. You can see it here:

- [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+FishEye]

I don't know if we still have any others, that's why I opened this Task.

h3. Updated 9-9-2013 (by Joe Wai Tye)

A quick check in the documentation shows that the correct permission is shown now.
fields.summary: Documentation still showing an old permission name
